title: President Xi US state visit: Jinping a man of great determination, says Henry Kissinger
text: More news, analysis and features at China Watch China and US should work in co-operation to deal with a series of global issues, former US Secretary of State Henry Kissinger said in an interview before President Xi Jinping's visit to the US. Calling Xi a man of great determination, Dr Kissinger looked forward to a consensus reached by China and US that the two countries need to work in co-operation and apply this conclusion to a number of concrete issues during Xi's visit. Some of the problems cannot be solved alone by either China or the US... As a man who opened up Sino-US relations and witnessed more than 40 years of development between the two countries, the former US top diplomat spoke highly of the economic achievement China has made and saw many common opportunities for bilateral ties. "If we don't work together, many of them can't be reached. Some of the problems cannot be solved alone by either China or the US, like climate, environment, proliferation, weapons of massive destruction, or cyber. These are all the things we need to deal with together," Kissinger said. He added that a confrontation "would be very unfortunate for both sides", and stressed that the two are obliged to work together. I am very hopeful that President Xi's visit to US will show progress in dialogue Kissinger, commenting on Xi's quest for a "new type of major country relationship", said it was necessary for both countries to give priority to bilateral ties and keep communications open with each other. "China will be growing, whether we accept it or don't accept it," Kissinger said, urging those who resist admitting China's increasing prominence to face the reality. He suggested that President Obama should "talk honestly to the Chinese, to tell them what their concerns are, to learn Chinese concerns. "I am very hopeful that President Xi's visit to US will show progress in dialogue," Kissinger said. This article was originally produced and published by China Daily .
